ranking.reasons: Comprehensive 8-domain coverage with Integration domain, strong MEC/evidence fidelity, actionable workstreams, clear prioritization logic, minimal gaps noted.
8 domains including Integration and Governance, excellent evidence citations, quantified success metrics, detailed gap analysis, strong business alignment.
8 domains with detailed Integration workstreams, strong MEC focus, quantified metrics, but slightly verbose and some redundancy in evidence excerpts.
8 domains with quantified metrics (p95 latency, MTTD), strong technical depth, but some success metrics lack BRD grounding (e.g., container startup <30s).
8 domains with Governance, good MEC compliance focus, clear workstreams, but less specificity in success metrics and slightly generic recommendations.
8 domains with Integration and Governance, strong evidence fidelity, but some workstreams lack concrete deliverables and prioritization logic less explicit.
6 domains (missing Integration and Governance), strong technical detail, good evidence citations, but lower coverage and less explicit prioritization rationale.
8 domains but Integration workstream underdeveloped, good MEC focus, clear risks, but some success metrics lack quantification and evidence less granular.
6 domains (missing Integration and Governance), concise but less comprehensive, some workstreams lack detail, fewer evidence citations, gaps less explicit.
5 domains only, different schema (not matching required JSON structure), good cross-cutting themes but lower domain coverage, less actionable workstreams.

notes: B_prompt edges out C_prompt with slightly better prioritization logic and clearer dependency mapping. Top 4 candidates (B, C, I, H) all deliver 8-domain coverage with strong evidence fidelity and actionable workstreams. A_prompt and E_prompt lose points for missing Integration/Governance domains. JUDGE_prompt_quality uses a different schema and lower domain granularity, scoring lowest despite good thematic analysis.
